intro: Bunium gypsaceum, commonly known as the gypsum fennel, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy fragrance. Bunium gypsaceum is often found growing in disturbed soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
